website_summaries.verdict: A solidly constructed saltwater reel that is great for larger fish.
pros: A strong, smooth drag that holds up to larger fish
Lightweight and made of solid materials
Anti-corrosion drive gear offers long performance life
Offers smooth drag to reduce fishing line break-offs
cons: A little bulkier than other saltwater reels

customer_reviews.title: Give it a try
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of experience fishing. I have competed at a very high level of fishing. I was just looking for an inexpensive basic spinning real. I was very surprised at the quality of this spinning real. I have compared it to my name brand, more expensive reels, and wished I would have known about this brand when I was paying three times for the same quality of gear. It is smooth with a smooth drag system. I would definitely recommend this product for people to try before spending more for a product that doesn't function as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Solomon

customer_reviews.title: It's been holding up as my surf fishing rod for ...
customer_reviews.text: It's been holding up as my surf fishing rod for about 2 months. It get lots of salt water on it but I lube it up and heavily rinse it with fresh water afterward. Will update if things go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have never left a bad review, I always try to find the bright side to everything, but can’t with this reel. I was so excited to give this to my husband for Christmas. Late January we got to take a quick fishing trip and he was able able to get 3 successful casts before the line jammed up in under the reel. Luckily, we always travel with a couple spare rods ready to go. Next morning he threw away the brand new line and bought lighter weight line and restrung it. Got two casts out before the same thing happened. Now during quarantine he tried again with more new line... same results.... Total waste of $80+ Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Orange Blossom

customer_reviews.title: Uneven line retrieval
customer_reviews.text: Nice quiet reel, but doesn’t retrieve the line on the spool in an even manner. I tried two different types of kevlar line and two different kinds of monofilament line. All lines produced the same effect, more line at the bottom of the spool then the top. This lead to the line getting all fouled up. We call them rats nests. The kevlar lines were strung at the stores where I purchased them. The monofilament line I put on myself. I bought this reel because I wanted as light a reel as possible. I own the Kodiak 3000 made by this company and it has been one of my favorite reels. I was very disappointed with the Sharky. Reel returned.
customer_reviews.author: Luddite

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST REEL I EVER OWNED!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love!! Paired it with a KastKing Royalle Rod 7 foot..Absolutely perfect fit and match. Its braid ready and I attached the braid right to it, no backing or tape required. When I used it out fishing it was awesome. Such a smooth reel and so quiet. No slippage or anything. Very nice..I can use it lefty if I like, which I do, I'm weird like that. After years of fishing, this is by far the best rod and reel I have ever owned. Definately will recommend and buy again when I'm ready for a larger one for a big surf rod and reel..Or as a gift..Happy fishing all :)
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Kastking internal mechanism breaks too quickly
customer_reviews.text: I had a Kastking 4000 for less than a year and used it less than a dozen times before the mechanism that prevents the bail from backing up when a fish bites broke. I advised Kastking of the defect and was promised a shipping label to return the reel after I emailed a photograph of the reel to confirn its identification. That was two months ago! Never heard from them since! I'm very disappointed especially since I've bought two Kastkings from Amazon already.
customer_reviews.author: fmnhawaii

customer_reviews.title: Did not last a month
customer_reviews.text: Ok... I purchased this, after reading the reviews on how great it was. I ordered it for my grandfather as a gift. I found out today that he had already thrown it away (less than a month later). When asking him what was wrong, he said that it felt like every gear on the inside had stripped out. Keep in mind, we are only fishing for various Bream and Crappie. After reading reviews, I expected this reel to last a long time. I learned my lesson. I’m sticking with Pfluger Presidentials from here on out for budget reels.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Good sealed reel for saltwater fishing
customer_reviews.text: I started with a standard rod and reel combo that eventually seized up from saltwater fishing use. I upgraded to this reel as it is advertised with sealed parts. I rinse all my reels after each use, and compared to my other less expensive reels, this one does not seize up from saltwater/sand as the others. I have used it many times and so far it is reliable enough that I bought another one.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, smooth and braid ready
customer_reviews.text: The KastKing Sharky III is a powerful and smooth reel. It feels like it is built very tough and has extremely smooth drag. I used it today with 10 lb braid and the drag did not fail me when catching 8 fish that pulled drag. The overall size appears a little smaller than other reels in the same size catagory but it still has the line capacity that is needed. The handle and wire for spool is thicker (tougher) than most reels in this price range. The spool is also braid ready so I was able to tie directly to the spool.
customer_reviews.author: Hops

customer_reviews.title: OK reels with some caveats.
customer_reviews.text: If a 60 dollar reel is all you can afford its an OK reel. Just keep in mind these aren’t built for catching any fish that actually put up a fight or run on you. I have the 3000 and the 5000 and the drag isnt nearly as finely adjustable as the Penn Battle reel I have and that will make all the difference if you are fishing around structure and need to actually control how and where that fish you hooked runs. Also after just 2 months already seeing that the drag is a bit uneven and getting a little sticky. I fish every weekend so my stuff gets used but not abused...
customer_reviews.author: Jason Brown

customer_reviews.title: Puzzled
customer_reviews.text: Puzzled. Many positive reviews, so I thought it was a good buy...how wrong I was. I found the reel to be very loud (I was using a braid) and not as smooth as I expected so I thought perhaps it was my braided line so I switched to the nylon and that’s where I found that now reel was even worse. Tangeled my line, after few times I give up! Switched to my older Daiwa and finally could enjoy my fishing! In all fairness I might had have a bad lemon but when I buy a NEW product expecting to have a good time but a bad product ruins what should be a relaxing trip I’m going elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Shemster

customer_reviews.title: Not a saltwater reel.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this because it was advertised for saltwater. THIS IS NOT A SALTWATER REEL. I used it 4 times, 3 in lake erie and it worked perfectly. Once in flor8da and within a couple hours, ot went feom grinding to locked up. DO NOT VUY THIS REEL FOR SALTWATER. it is great for freshwater. A reel should last for 5 to 10 years in my opinion. It is useless today and i r8nsed the heck out of it after us8ng it the first day in saltwater.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What just happened?
customer_reviews.text: After 3rd day of fishing from shore my reel broke off from my new rod ( ugly stick). I was using braided line, 3/4oz. sinker and wire liter. Hooked an 11in mangrove snapper from shore and then the reel broke . I was fortunate enough to save my rod fro floating away and pull the line in by hand. Finished the day with my cheaper back up rod and reel total retail 42.00 including tax. Now im out a new reel plus the cost of spooling and line. First time ever writing a review. Before this happend i had caught my snapper limit 2 days in a row with the reel .
customer_reviews.author: theo gonite

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement on drag, hard to beat in its price range.
customer_reviews.text: I own several other KastKing reels and they all have high pound drag system. This one is definitely one of the best.It takes about four full turns on the knob to adjust the drag from minimum to maximum, which makes it very precise for different drag requirements. Also it starts vert smoothly under low drag settings. works well for both heavy and light tackles. One of the best improvements I preferred! The braided line ready spool is a plus. For $50, this reel is unbeatable. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Susanna

customer_reviews.title: 1 out of 3 reels spools unevenly
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 other Kastking Sharky 3 reels.. a 4000 and a 5000.. I just purchased another one (5000) for a new rod I bought, and I spooled on 30lb braided and it spooled very unevenly filling up the back/bottom and leaving the top with almost no line. I looked up the fix online and it said to make it spool more at the top I need to remove the spool and take out a washer, unfortunatly the reel only has one washer. I will try fishing with it the way it is but i might have to return it. Before I do that I'm gonna take it to the local sports store and see if they can fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Carcosa

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: i purchased the 1000 model and loved it. My dad needed a new reel so I ordered him a 2000 model and it's been almost 2 months and already broke. Not sure what's wrong with it but it feels like a coffee grinder even after I took it apart to try giving it some oil. Pretty disappointed, I own a lot of kast king products and I have previously liked them. We put our reels through some abuse but considering that I have other less quality reels last many years and still hold up is definitely going to make me think twice before buying more kast king products
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Not a 5000 size reel, not even close
customer_reviews.text: I took the risk and purchased a couple of these in 5000 size.. What I received isn't any bigger than a standard 3000 reel. If this is their 5000 size, it has no line capacity whatsoever. As a 30 year saltwater guide, I've never seen a 5000 spinning reel half sized like this one. Very discouraging after reading all the reviews. I'll be happy to change my review if I receive a 5000 size reel following the standard of proper size with the rest of the spinning reel market.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. RL

customer_reviews.title: Kastking Sharky 3 2000 and 4000 series
customer_reviews.text: The spinning reels are good for the money. I wont go through and talk about the spec, you can read that yourself. The reel is basically plastic and the handles feels a little cheap. over all good reel for the money and a plus that it is sealed. I used it in the lakes and pulled in 10 lbs fish easy and I used it in the ocean. I like it so far. When i used it salt water, i normal rinse my reel after.
customer_reviews.author: Killereef

customer_reviews.title: Sweet reels for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Love Kastking products. Great value for the money. This reel rocks. Casts great and reeling is smooth as butter. That drag has incredible stopping power if you use it right. I own two of these. A 1000 and 3000. The 3000 is my favorite. My only complaint was the 1000 was a bit too heavy to pair with my ultra light rods for trout.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A Fileccia

customer_reviews.title: Bang for Buck
customer_reviews.text: Got this reel for my girlfriend for her birthday as a cheaper alternative as she is a bit more prone to dunking the reel. Have already gone through 2 Shakespeare reels. Very nice feel and has survived one dunking thus far. Haven't used enough to comment on true durability but for the price it seems it's very well worth it. Update: has survived almost a year and still working great. Have not had to tear down even once.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Definitely go with the 3000 size if you are fishing for largemouth bass.
customer_reviews.text: I've put about 20 hours into this reel and I absolutely love it so far. I was using a 2000 size Abu Garcia silver max and when compared side by side I was blown away by the quality of the materials and overall performance of the Kastking. I decided to go with the 3000 size as my finesse reel for largemouth bass. It doesn't feel clunky or heavy and the drag system is awesome. The best part about this reel is the price! I am picking up the 5000 size to use for catfish and saltwater fishing over the summer. Thank you Kastking for making an amazing product that doesn't cost an arm and a leg!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Fishing Reel For The Price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this fishing reel because I wanted something inexpensive that I would mind scuffing up. This fishing reel has (almost) surpassed my expectations in every way. It is a solid fishing reel and can handle anything that a sub $150 reel can catch. It reels in smooth and is well built. I say this as an owner of two high-end Penn fishing reels. The only downside that I can see is that they come in small sizes and their 5000 size is closer to a 3000-ish Penn reel. If you're on a budget and don't need a whole bunch of line capacity, buy this reel.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: Super smooth, lightweight reel that is saltwater approved quality at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Love my new Sharky III reel. It is super lightweight but still powerful with 39.5lb drag. The retrieve is super smooth thanks to 10+1 stainless steel, saltwater rated ball bearings. With that quality, you just can’t beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the money but one draw back
customer_reviews.text: Felt this reel is a very good buy for the money based on I own 4 made in Japan Shimano reals to compare them to. Have not fished with them yet. Chose them over Phlugers due to more BB's and significantly heavier drag. Will see how they measure up to my Shimano Symmetry reals long considered the best spinning reals under $100. The only reason why I didn't give the reel four stars was it didn't come with a spare spool. First reel I ever bought that didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Have taken it both saltwater an fresh water fishing. Sadly the saltwater trip was a sunk but the reel worked wonderfully paired with a 10' Penn Squadron rod. On the fresh water trip it pulled in countless cat fish with ease(Paired on a 6' Shimano FX). I had to loosen the drag to allow my children (3&4 years old) to enjoy the fight a little. I highly recommend this reel the castablility is amazing and the retrieve is silky smooth with great line lay! Can't wait to try more from KastKing
customer_reviews.author: Korey Cox

customer_reviews.title: Kastking
customer_reviews.text: I was really hesitant about buying one of these but ended up pleasantly surprised. This is a very good quality reel for the price. I haven't fished it in saltwater so I don't know how it would hold up there but it's a great little freshwater reel for sure. One thing to keep in mind is they run a little small for numbering they use. I bought a 5000 and it's actually a little smaller than the 4000s I have from other brands. Other than that it's a great little reel
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the KastKing Sharky 3 in a 3000 size along with 20lb KastKing KastPro braid for use in both freshwater and saltwater. This quality of this reel is amazing! After taking several dunks in fresh and saltwater plus a beating from sand the reel still works amazing and the drag is strong as ever. I have bought more since! You won’t be disappointed in this reel!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Buttery smooth, lightweight, high quality, and best of all...relatively inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Kast King reel. I have been looking at them on Amazon for quite a while but I was honestly a bit skeptical. I own Daiwa, Shimano, and Abu Garcia reels. Let me tell you....don't hesitate! This reel is the best spinning reel of the lot! It is buttery smooth and has good ergonomics. I couldn't be more pleased with my purchase. This reel is actually much lighter than some of my more expensive reels. I don't know how Kast King is making such a great product for low prices, but I sure hope they stay this way. They will have a customer for life if so.
customer_reviews.author: indianaj222

customer_reviews.title: Awesome reel!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant prior to purchasing, but I'm so glad I did. This thing is a smooth-casting machine. The drag is solid and it holds 300 yards of 40lb Power Pro easily. It is a little smaller than I was expecting, but there have been no issues with inshore and light offshore fishing action. I will likely purchase at least one more of these, as well as a larger model if I can find one. It compares well with Okuma and Pflueger reels of the same size.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B.

customer_reviews.title: How is this a 3000?!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the 3000. what was delivered was a box that said 3000. but the reel is TINY and is a 1000! SO CLOSE to my fishing trip! QC? I hope not because Amazon is shipping out a replacement to be delivered tomorrow. Hopefully it's not the same 1000 in a 3000 box!
customer_reviews.author: ale

customer_reviews.title: Little concerned
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I really wanted to like this reel given all the positive reviews on amazon and the price level made it very affordable. "Reality check" Used the reel for less than a month: ~25-30 hours of fishing time. Reel is making a very loud "clicking" noise during retrive and and during the last trip the bail wont stay open that caused my lure to fly off... I am not sure if it is a quality control issue or what, but very disappointed. I am just glad it is still under free return.
customer_reviews.author: BlueJay

customer_reviews.title: Superior reel at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't to sure about ordering the SHARKY III 4000. Simply because I'm more of a baitcaster person. But once I received the reel I was amazed . Such a beautiful reel, felt great in the hand, light weight and the performance of the reel is outstanding. It has a superior drag system and built like a tank but the weight of almost nothing. I am glad I purchased the Sharky III. It will make a very nice addition to the KastKing family of reels I have now . Thank you KastKing for another outstanding product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Tallman

customer_reviews.title: Fell Apart!? See Pic
customer_reviews.text: Back it goes. The bail literally fell apart when I was casting. Only had used it a couple of times. The tangles are because i simply opened the bail to cast and didn't realize it fell apart instead of catching and reeling the brail line in.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W

customer_reviews.title: Temper your expectations accordingly.
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than expected and not quite as smooth as my Shimano NASCI, but for half the price I can't be mad. I'll update once I actually start to use it in the water, but initial impression is good. It's what you would expect from a $50 reel. Just don't expect it to match up to reels in the $100 range. Update: I tried it in the water today and it's just an ok reel. I put 15lb braided lines on it and I was surprised how much of an effort it takes to operate the reel. Like I said in my original post, don't expect the smoothness and weight of a $100 reel.
customer_reviews.author: Kong Lee

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I'm a novice fisherman and I wanted a telescoping rod to carry in my trailer. Based on the good reviews of the KastKing rod, I picked this reel to go with it. So far it seems very nice, best reel I've ever used for sure. Loaded up a 2000 reel with the KastKing 8 lb braided line which is also superb. No line memory coming out of the reel, it just hangs nice and limp.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Sharky 3 5000 silky smooth and light weight reel
customer_reviews.text: I only fish occasionally,about 5 months ago when I received this reel,it was like love at 1st sight lol, But now it’s started showing a little problem,the bail doesn’t close all the way when I shut it and it has a lot of play on it when it shuts,it doesn’t effect the reel performance or anything but still very disappointing for me,this all the have for now,I’ll come back and update the review if there’s anymore problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky.s

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I've had this reel for 2 months now, and I used it once in a freshwater lake. The reel was used from a boat and never got dunked. I took it out yesterday on the kayak and it was binding up so bad it had become a chore to use. I had the Sharky II for a year or so with good luck. It ended up failing due to me not cleaning it after saltwater from a recent trip. For the money I expected this one to last more than one trip out.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Reel Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Texas All Water Fishing Youtuber, great spinning reel. Paired with Speed Demon Shakey Head 7' rod & Kastking braid it's pulled 18 speckled trout out, 22 inch red fish, a several nice size flounder. I've used it while wade fishing, kayak fishing, and took it out via boat pulled some big sheepshead out no problem. Cast well no issues so far, feels great in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben R

customer_reviews.title: Cheap reel, cheap price, stay away
customer_reviews.text: So I've been using this reel for less than a year, I maintain it regularly, and up until a today everything has been fine. Today the reel stopped spinning, and having opened and lubricated the reel numerous times I figured I've already violated the warranty so I've got to fix it. I open it up to find brass pinion in the middle is shredded and the main cranking gear is trashed. Pay a little more, get a Shimano, a Daiwa, or an Abu Garcia. Until Kastking can put better quality parts into their reels, they aren't worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Brock Hinson

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth, great value!
customer_reviews.text: I have almost 40 years of slat water fishing experience. Based on reviews, I bought 2 of the 4000's and 1 of 3000 size. They are very smooth and a bit smaller than expected for the series. I would say 4000 for Speckled Trout,Redfish and Flounder .if you are wanting a medium to heavy reel for Bigger or saltwater fishing or surf casting. I would go with 5000 series. Although the 38 lb drag should handle any fish I will fight, its just a smaller frame and less line capacity. Very impressed at how balanced and smooth they are. And the price cant be beat when you compare to a Shimano brand or Penn!
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Wow great reel
customer_reviews.text: I got the 3000 series. Wow, its a great spinning reel. I was really surprised by the quality for the price. I may only buy KastKing reels from now on. After being on the water i can say this reel is REALLY REALLY smooth, i like it better than my Kastking baitcaster :) Update. I known own 2 of these, wanted to get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Salado

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad little reel
customer_reviews.text: Ok so far reel has been very good. I use it maybe a few times a month when we're at the beach on a 10 ft surf rod with 30lb braid. I've been able to cast quite far. Smooth and seems to be holding up to the saltwater. I've caught all types of fish Snook, Permit and small sharks. I rinse after each use, this is very important if you fish saltwater. Only concern is the size. The 5000 I purchased is about the size of a 3000 or at best 4000 series Penn reel. Reel seems small for its listed size. But so far it's been working great as the occasional surf reel.
customer_reviews.author: Chet

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and quiet
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying this is the first rod and reel I have purchased as an adult. My experience level is beginner to intermediate. I had fished with loaner rigs before now. For the weekend bass and crappie fishing I do, this has served me well this season. I paired this reel with a KastKing Royale Legend spinning rod. I have purchased several other KastKing products, and I am highly satisfied by the quality and value.
customer_reviews.author: S. Chaney

customer_reviews.title: I have a durable and reel for sure..
customer_reviews.text: I so apologize I wrote a review yesterday I regret sending . I had a change of mind ..I wrote a bad review when I shouldn't of ..I should of waited till I actually use the reel that I thought was all plastic..I was wrong so wrong.. ..its actually mostly metal parts I thought was plastic..but after I used the reel on a adventure in sweetwater lake in spring valley, California.i was so happy with my reel and fishing experience. I love it .I'm actually so proud to own it thank you and thank you kast king for the awesome product such craftmanship and quality!!#
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Overrated reel only popular online
customer_reviews.text: I used this reel and another $100 Daiwa BG reel and a few cheap reels. This reel is better than the $10 cheap reels, but a lot worse than the $100 Daiwa reel. It is not very smooth. When you reel in with a 5oz sinker, you can feel it is not smooth. I don't see other friends using this one. Their Daiwa and Shimano reels at similar prices are better than this one. I don't recommend this reel.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Works great !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this reel to put in a rear rod holder with live bait while I was casting lures from the front and didn’t a fish to pull the rod out while I’m not looking. I’ve caught Spanish mackerel, jacks, and various other varieties and the reel has performed flawlessly. The most surprising thing to me is the drag is very smooth and so far no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Bowers

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used mine it didn't go so well. The insides came apart. Return window closed so I guess it is what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan G.

customer_reviews.title: This may be my new favorite reel! Exactly what I was searching for
customer_reviews.text: This may be my new favorite reel! Exactly what I was searching for...light, a ton of drag and holds a good amount of line for it's size. I loaded with 50 lb braid, 50 lb flour leader and put on a medium heavy rated for up to 30 lb braid. Jigged and pulled in a 28", 12 lb snapper, cast for Bonita and brought in with no problem. Drag seems awesome. Kept it light so never wore me out fishing all day. Impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Brett Hartranft

customer_reviews.title: Seems strong
customer_reviews.text: Send to be a nice reel. It isn't what I was expecting from reading the line size it will handle. It doesn't hold 20 lb monofilament. It is a maximum of 16. Maybe I read stuff wrong! But was expecting a larger reel size. Overall I think it will be a good reel in the long run! Can't fault the company for my mistake......
customer_reviews.author: Johnny L. Nolan

customer_reviews.title: My thoughts after a year of use.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try the Sharky III reel. I typically use high end "name brand" reels but upon arrival I was super impressed with the look and feel of the reel. In my excitement I spooled #50 braid on the reel. We use #50lb braid for a floating worm and we typically fish the floating worm around heavy cover. On my first outing I hooked up with 15 fish with the largest being ~5lbs. This reel did not disappoint, it cast smoothly, the drag is perfect and it can handle the fish/heavy cover like a champ. I am happy with the performance and consistency I have experienced from this reel. Thanks KastKing!
customer_reviews.author: Triton197

customer_reviews.title: Great Reel when it works
customer_reviews.text: I love this Reel on my ugly stik lite, amazing fight on blue fish, bass, and albies, getting slammed and getting them into the kayak/boat is amazingly fun, I spray it down with fresh water everytime I bring it out into the sea, and one day it just doesn't feel like reeling in lines anymore, everytime I try reeling it in, the initial second or so, it would lock up, and I have to release, reverse the handle and try again before it would start working. I've taken good care of it, and find it hard to believe that it breaks so easily, considering that this series is build for bigger fish.
customer_reviews.author: Po hau

customer_reviews.title: Flawed design
customer_reviews.text: It has a major design flaw. There is a gap Katherine enough to allow the line to get caught under the mechanism. After a few times I just gave up and put it away. Totally useless.
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.  KastKing really supports their products.
customer_reviews.text: Reel is smooth. Drag is exceptional. Beautiful finish. I have another reel that cost 3 times as much but doesn't work any better than this. What's even better is that KastKing sent me a spare spool for $6.50 that I keep wound with different line for a quick change out. Great customer support!
customer_reviews.author: Tim C

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after light surf fishing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this reel for light salt water fishing. After fishing for an hour on light surf I realized the handle was wobbling and I realized the handle cap screw was missing. I thought maybe it was my fault maybe I didn't tighten the cap enough but it was actually a part from the reel body that the cover threads onto that had came apart along with a bearing. customer service was really nice and helpful and are willing to replace the reel or refund it. other than that I liked the reel but I would rather keep it for fresh water use.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Kastking Sharjy III
customer_reviews.text: It arrived promptly two days ago. Yesterday I loaded it with 100 yards of eight pound test line and set the drag to 2 1/2 pounds. Took it down to my dock today and tried it out - it worked great. My casting distance probably increased by at least 30 feet (of course my old reel was 1960's vintage). Retrieval was very smooth. Haven't caught any fish with it yet - but it's just a matter of time.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Clemons

customer_reviews.title: The reel has a monster spool and holds a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: The reel has a monster spool and holds a lot of line. With 10# braided splder wire it took over 300 yards. So if you are going to use braided line you probably should back it with mono. The reel requires considerable force to close after casting. Very smooth and balanced retrieve. If the bail closer was more traditional I would have given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Well built.
customer_reviews.text: Well built casts pretty well. I’m running a 10lb Ozark Mono backer with about 100yds of 40lb Sufix 832 braid with a 14lb Yozuri Top-knot Fluoro leader. ~2ft Slapped on a Gamatsu 8/0 Octopus Hook and a big chunk of Hot Dog. Caught that little Largemouth Bass and released em quickly. Cranks fast!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Kovalesky

customer_reviews.title: Good Southern California surf fishing reel.
customer_reviews.text: I use the Sharky III on a nine foot steelhead rod for fishing the California Surf. The reel is handling the salt and surf conditions very well. The casting is smooth and the casting distance allows me to reach the areas where the fish hang out. I am using 30lb Kastking braid and the spool capacity is very good. Overall this reel is working great.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Great reel!
customer_reviews.text: I took the reel fishing at the mouth of the rio grande river. A year later I took out this reel and it was still working. All my other reels did not work. The other reels where shakespeare that came with fishing poles that I got from walmart and sams. So i will be buying more of these reels for my rods.
customer_reviews.author: James Fournier

customer_reviews.title: Are you fooling me with products that others have used?
customer_reviews.text: When I just received the item, there was a bump on it, and if I touched it with my hand, I would feel cut. If it is a thread, it is estimated that the thread will be broken after a few rounds. I should not give me second-hand goods at the original price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Reel! A Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: The KastKing Sharky II is my favorite spinning reel, so naturally I had to get the Sharky III when it came out. It did not disappoint. I spooled it up and took it out to test it out as soon as I got it. Incredibly smooth and sturdy. The great thing, it's a saltwater reel which changes the game entirely. I'm going to really enjoy catching some saltwater species with this reel.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Yanez

customer_reviews.title: Right in the box it impressed me
customer_reviews.text: I buy lots of reels, Daiwa, Shimano and Penn mainly. I expected little for a $50 reel but this is like others twice that price. Well packaged. I would have liked a slightly thinner spool spacer due to the very thin line i use(berkley x9) but will call the company and see if i can get one. nice reel.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it at this price.
customer_reviews.text: When I received this reel I immediately compared it to my Pflueger President (which retails for more $) and couldn't believe how well it compared. On paper the specs are great, especially the drag, but in your hand the smoothness from the bearing and the quality of the build can be felt. Couldn't believe how great of a reel this is, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Ride Along Fishing

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT Fishing Reel!
customer_reviews.text: Traditionally, I've been a "Penn Man". My other 5 reels are all Penn Reels. I fish almost every day in SW Florida, wade-fishing for Sae Trout, Snook, Redfish, Flounder, Mackerel, and Pompano. I bought this KastKing Sharky just to see if it was any good. I have used it now approx 15 times. It's a GREAT reel! Smooth action, plenty of line, well balanced...I'll DEFINITELY buy another when I need a new reel!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Belisle

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I fish inshore from a kayak every weekend and normally use Shimano Sedona and Sahara 3000 series reels. Thought I would try the Sharky III in a 2000 series based on the line capacity and weight. Worked great with 20lb braid catching upper slot reds and trout this past weekend. Have an upcoming tournament that it will get used in. Will definitely going to order 2 more of these in the near future!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Stubbs

customer_reviews.title: The BEST Bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: This Reel has everything that used to look for in reels that I would pay between $120 and $240 for. So far it is standing up GREAT! I originally bought one for my father, he picked it out and I was so impressed with it I bought one for myself. Earlier today I ordered my 2nd KastKing rod and reel to use for the Fall Steelhead Run. I guess this will be the REAL test if they hold up as well as my old go-to, Shimano / St. Croix set ups!
customer_reviews.author: Barry A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Smooth & Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I have used this reel a few times now in salt water - so far so good :) Still smooth & quiet. I have landed several fish with this reel already including a 37" snook with it - the drag performed very well. I am looking forward to continue using this reel and I hope it holds up and lasts.
customer_reviews.author: TommyB_Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Not very smooth after a couple of fishing trips
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately does not hold up well in frequent fishing in saltwater like big name brands. After a couple of trips became not very smoot and I had to take it apart and libicate and clean to get to be usable again. I do take care of my gear every time I come back from fishing. Quality can be better
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Small price...Small feel....Excelent value!
customer_reviews.text: This reel is of excellent quality and yet another great product by KastKing. I have it paired with a ten foot surf rod and it is very lightweight and has stood up to some nice fish. My one complaint is the size of the reel. For a 5000 series reel it feels very anorexic in hand. For a smaller rod set-up it’d do excellent but maybe surf fishing isn’t it’s strong suit. I will be looking into the KastKing Sharky 3 baitfeeder 6000 to replace it on my surf rod. It will then be re-homed to my Berkeley Big Game 8 foot rod for sound/pier/first gut casting pole. Main take-away: excellent product! Don’t hesitate to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could be the best spinning reel I’ve ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Could be the one of if not the best spinning reel I’ve ever owned. The drag system is the best I’ve ever seen and it’s just such a spectacular looking reel. Do yourself a favor and purchase one of these. You won’t regret it I now have 4 of them and I use them finesse fishing bass, crappie fishing, Catfishing(Baitfeeder model) and just recently on my Trout/Steelhead rod.
customer_reviews.author: Chris McVey

customer_reviews.title: don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought two, one for me and one for my wife. First day, had problems with them, line keep getting caught up around the spool, than a grinding noise in mine, after a few hours...I changed them to my old reels. Yes, I even changed the line! Garage!
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Glad I saved up
customer_reviews.text: Fish almost beg me to get caught just to check this thing out. It is very durable, it's light, it's super responsive, what else could you want? I would buy again in a heart beat. So smooth.
customer_reviews.author: O. Family Account

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Value for Money
customer_reviews.text: The overall build quality is excellent. The action is very smooth and the drag system is powerful as well as being very easy to adjust. The packaging was very good and the included operating instructions and tips were very informative and useful. The storage bag was also a bonus. This will not be the last KastKing reel that I purchase and I would recommend this product to anyone looking for a good quality reel without breaking the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Morton.

customer_reviews.title: Good gitl
customer_reviews.text: There was defect with 1000 reel I received twice so I had to order it off the website. Since then I have not experience this problem. But on other note make sure to gease or spray that side. Other then that the reel is smooth and good for the price. Special ly the drag on u
customer_reviews.author: Lo lo

customer_reviews.title: Amazed!
customer_reviews.text: I originally was a big fan of the Penn Fierce. I was told by a buddy that he had a Sharky and he was very impressed with it. I decided to try it for myself and have now fallen in love with this series. Better engineering than the Penn Fierce with toughness and smoothness.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Simko

customer_reviews.title: Performed way beyond what it should have!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple of these Sharky 3000 reels and paired them with the kastking med action perigee rods. Stringed them with 15lb kastking braided line and 25lb Fluorocarbon leader. This is my first kastking set up and definitely will not be my last! These things are built just as good if not better then my $400 set ups. I reeled in this 46" 42lb beast like I was reeling in a Bass. It took me less then 1 min to land this sucker. I'm still floored on how well this rod, reel and line performed! If you have any doubt's squash them and pick one up before there prices go up.
customer_reviews.author: Ditto74

customer_reviews.title: YEP....I WANT ANOTHER
customer_reviews.text: Best bang for your buck. I have been fishing all my life and have never understood why I buy the expensive tackle when my middle of the road products is what I use most. However this reel is the exception. Low cost with high quality. I have it on a 10' Ugly Still and it works wonders. At first I thought it would be alittle small but after spring and summer of using it, I fell in love with it. The drag works well enough that I can pull in flounder and Ray's with no problem. I can easily say I am very happy with the reel. I plan on getting a couple more for my pier rods this fall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazo

customer_reviews.title: Good for inshore saltwater so far
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t found anything wrong with this reel yet. I’ve used it for inshore saltwater 6 times and rinse it with water when I’m done. I handled and turns just as they day I took it out of the box. I am impressed in its durability and salt water resistance, whether it will hold up after a year... only time will tell. The drag on this irrelevant is great, it feels good and is easy to adjust and dial in on the fly. Overall good value and good product, I am going to purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, strong, beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Sharky III 4000 for the walleye run season month ago, it works perfectly on the river, the drag is strong and smooth. I hit 6 suckers this Thursday (odd, i know, lol) and amazingly one 8 pounders was snagged on the belly but the reel handled it easily; the rest catches are walleyes and it reels in as smooth as you can dream.... This reel performed the same way my Ci4 does but only cost a quarter of it, super!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stone Shi

customer_reviews.title: Best of the best!!!
customer_reviews.text: These reels are awesome! I own a 1000 and a 3000 and absolutely love them both! I've hooked up with some good sized stripers and hybrids on the 1000 and it handles them like a champ! I use the 3000 for bass but it sees saltwater action several times a year and is still going strong! It's hauled in numerous upper-slot redfish and never skips a beat! The drag is beefy feeling and even after serious abuse it's smooth as butter! These reels, in my opinion, are the absolute best bang for your buck and will dominate or at least hang with many much more expensive reels!!
customer_reviews.author: Ashumms

customer_reviews.title: The BEST all purpose spinning reel
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredible reel for the price. I’ve used it on countless fishing trips this year and can honestly say that the quality is on par with my friends’ and family’s more expensive gear, but the Sharky has more and better features. The action is silky smooth, the EVA knob is very comfortable, and the drag feels like it could pull in a Prius. I currently have this reel paired with a 7’ Kastking Blackhawk telescopic rod and it has become one of, if not the most reliable combo in my fishing rod arsenal. I plan on buying another variant in 2000 or 3000.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S

customer_reviews.title: Very good reel.
customer_reviews.text: This is the nicest reel I own now. I've only ever used Walmart(or equivalent) $15-30 reels in my 30 years of on and off fishing. I've never tried a super expensive reel($100+), but I can say that this reel feels soooo much better than any of my other reels. I highly recommend this one! I'll be buying another soon to replace my other reel.
customer_reviews.author: mattman

customer_reviews.title: Got the 5000 and couldn't be happier with the current performance
customer_reviews.text: Got the 5000 and couldn't be happier with the current performance. As many others have stated its very smooth and a great value for the money. Have had this in both fresh water and salt water (rinse after every salt water trip). Time will tell if this reel is a keeper. 4 Stars for the features and price. Will update after many more months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Josh S

customer_reviews.title: Finally got it taken apart.
customer_reviews.text: When I spin it, the center shaft goes up and at the bottom of the cycle it locks. I will grease and put back together but this reel is inferior to many older (some even 40 years older) This is my second Sharky III and both are more trouble than they are worth.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Smithling

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice looking reel
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice looking reel. It feels real solid and tight. Everything seems to work quite smoothly and tolerances seem precise. Only 4 stars because I have not fished it yet! Look forward to using it this spring, but spring is late in Eastern Oregon this year. Bought this to catfish on the Snake River starting in May. Order and delivery were great as usual...Thank You
customer_reviews.author: Buster

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, easy casting reel for $50
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a garbage broken shakespeare reel, very impressed with the smoothness. Very nicely paired with a med/light action rod for bass/trout fishing. Been out with it around 4 times now and landed a couple small fish, hopefully it holds up in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Frank A.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected reel
customer_reviews.text: Good fishing reel so far for bass. Used it last weekend and it costs about 50 yards with braided love and a top water busy but. Caught 2 1-pounders and lost a bigger one. Will be buying one of their baiting reels too.
customer_reviews.author: BigRed

customer_reviews.title: Dependable quality
customer_reviews.text: Pairs this with a Kastking Royal Legend medium rod I bought separately. Best combo I own to date! My hook-up ratio has increased and the amount of complements I receive from other anglers regarding purely the look of this reel is fantastic! Love it and wouldnt hesitate to buy again! Also strung with Kastking Superpower Braided line. Beautiful set up
customer_reviews.author: Zaokar

customer_reviews.title: Good reel, no issues
customer_reviews.text: I had no issues fishing with this reel. The price is great for what you get, solid quality. if this was my only reel and I wasn't obsessed with fishing then I'd say I'd never need another reel other than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: My Brother Likes Sharky 2500 Size
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my brother and we've been out several times with it. Coupled with a Fenwick Eagle M/L 6'6" rod and KastKing braid it makes a great all day rig for fresh water. He said the fatigue factor was way down after a long day on the water. So far it's very comparable to Phlueger President reels we own.
customer_reviews.author: Jon P.

customer_reviews.title: The quality and a build of this reel is very good
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this has got be be one of the best reels I have purchased. I do a lot of intercoastal fishing for flounder and red drum. With the high drag on these reels, I have not lost a fish yet, to include a 35" red drum that was pulling my kayak all over the place. I will be looking to get more this spring as fishing season starts to ramp up. I am completely satisfied with my purchases and would highly recommend to friends and family looking for a new reel.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Canfield

customer_reviews.title: A new fisher"man" deserves a new reel.
customer_reviews.text: I now own 2 Kastking reels, my son just bought one as well. My old one is actually corroded just behind the place where the line slides onto the spool...saltwater is a very tough environment for these materials...the coating is not as resistant as it should be. But for now, it is functional because it's not where the line rubs on its way into the spool. Your reels cast better than any i've owned, daiwa, shimano, penn and others. thanks
customer_reviews.author: SMac

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for Salmon
customer_reviews.text: This is nice and smooth reel just like others say. But the drag can definitely NOT handle a ten pound Salmon. That is the only thing I am disappointed in with this reel. I lost more than I brought in. Other reels of the same size do not struggle as much. If I were to purchase this reel again, it would be the smaller size an only be a trout reel.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Williams

customer_reviews.title: Best feature: nearly perfect drag
customer_reviews.text: Best feature: nearly perfect drag. Worst feature: screw-in handle. This reel is good for light and ultralight setups. It won't feel as smooth as a $100+ reel, but it doesn't cost $100... I don't know how long it will last, but if it goes two seasons of heavy fishing it will be worth the $. I still prefer reels like a Shimano Sedona to this one now that I have them side by side.
customer_reviews.author: Tony T.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome reel
customer_reviews.text: Amazing reel for amazing price. Lightweight strong and smooth. Drag is super strong and overall the reel is very comfortable. Also love the color scheme. Been using for a few weeks and absolutely in love.
customer_reviews.author: Seth L

customer_reviews.title: So far I am extremely pleased with this real
customer_reviews.text: So far I am extremely pleased with this real. Do to an unfortunate incident I had to replace a couple pflueger president reels. I did get one pflueger and one of these and honestly so far I like this reel better. Of course only time will tell if it will match the pflueger in dependability and longevity.
customer_reviews.author: w.c.

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: Great reel! As described. The build quality is even better than I expected. As good of not better, in all ways, than my Pflueger President a pinning reels with similar specs. Blown away by the quality, looks, and value here. I see why Kastking is becoming a leader!
customer_reviews.author: R. Fife

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Functionality wise this is a great reel! Been using it a bunch bass fishing and happy with my purchase. Only complaint is that the red anodizing has started to turn a little bit Orange but that’s not a bad problem to have while fishing
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C

customer_reviews.title: Best reel for surf fishing & best for any kind of fishing!!
customer_reviews.text: Best reel I have ever owned!!! Use for surf fishing for perch 3-4 times every week got saltwater & sand splashed on no problem!!!! Just rinse with water & ready smooth again!!! Will buy again, but never have to cuz it still works like new after many times used!! Best reel thx Kast King for making the best reel out there!!!!
customer_reviews.author: BuccLao

customer_reviews.title: Gotta Get One!
customer_reviews.text: Received this reel yesterday and spooled it with 10 pound Berkley FireLine Crystal put it on my 7ft Daiwa Laguna ML rod and went to the lake to give it a workout. Riged some Senkos wacky style and just destroyed the bass! The reel functioned smoothly and the drag worked perfectly. This reel functions like a $200 rig and was only 1/4 the price. The 2000 model holds plenty of line (125 yards of 10 pound Fireline) to get any job done. By the way....I have been fishing more than 40 years and have purchased $$$$ worth of gear, this is the first time I have felt compelled to write a review this product was so IMPRESSIVE!
customer_reviews.author: KindleChick

product_meta.title: KastKing Sharky III Fishing Reel - New Spinning Reel - Carbon Fiber 39.5 LBs Max Drag - 10+1 Stainless BB for Saltwater or Freshwater - Oversize Shaft - Super Value!
feature_bullets: NEXT-GEN - The brand new design KastKing Sharky III spinning reels are built tough to land trophy fish in all fishing conditions. Sharky III are superb lightweight fishing reels built with a high percentage fiber reinforced graphite body and rotor!

PURE POWER - You will love Sharky III spinning reel's amazing best-in-class up to 39.5LBs / 18KG of smooth, reliable triple disc carbon fiber drag, oversized stainless-steel main shaft, and stronger precision mesh manganese brass pinion gears for more fishing muscle.

K.I.S.S. - Sharky III spinning reels are sealed with a KISS! Sharky III has a unique protection water resistant design for its spool, body, and rotor - K.I.S.S. (KastKing Intrusion Shield System). It helps keep water and dirt out.

SUPER SMOOTH - You'll be blown away by the quiet, silky smooth retrieve of the Sharky III. Plus, with the unique Shark Fin Braid Ready aluminum spool, you no longer need to use backing line when spooling on braid fishing line.

AFFORDABLE INNOVATION - Sharky III spinning reel is loaded with features, including 10 + 1 high quality, saltwater rated double shielded stainless steel ball bearings, instant lock anti-reverse, stainless steel hardware, aluminum handle, and more line capacity than other brands. It is the best all-around spinning reel for every angler.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
